Description.val:
The FY 2021 funding request was reduced by $2.000 million to account for the availability of prior year execution balances.

Cooperative Engagement Capability (CEC) significantly improves Battle Force Anti-Air Warfare (AAW) capability by coordinating all Battle Force AAW sensors into a single, real-time, composite track picture capable of fire control quality.  CEC distributes sensor data from each ship and aircraft, or cooperating unit (CU), to all other CUs in the battle force through a real-time, line of sight, high data rate sensor and engagement data distribution network.  CEC is highly resistant to jamming and provides accurate gridlocking between CUs.  Each CU independently employs high capacity, parallel processing and advanced algorithms to combine all distributed sensor data into a fire control quality track picture which is the same for all CUs.  CEC data is presented as a superset of the best AAW sensor capabilities from each CU; all of which are integrated into a single input to each CU's combat weapons system.  CEC significantly improves Battle Force defense in depth, including both local area and ship defense capabilities against current and future AAW threats.  Moreover, CEC provides critical connectivity and integration of over-land air defense systems capable of countering emerging air threats, including land attack cruise missiles, in a complex littoral environment.

CEC consists of the Data Distribution System (DDS), the Cooperative Engagement Processor (CEP), and Combat System modifications. The DDS encodes and distributes ownship sensor and engagement data and is a high capacity, jam resistant, directive system providing a precision gridlocking and high throughput of data. The CEP is a high capacity distributed processor that is able to process force levels of data in near real time. This data is passed to the ship's combat system as high quality data for which the ship can cue its onboard sensors or use the data to engage targets without actually tracking them.  The CEC suite contains a C-Band antenna, the antenna's power and cooling equipment, a Signal Data Processor (SDP), and system support equipment.  The current CEC Shipboard antenna variants include the Shipboard Active Aperture (SBAA) and the Planar Array Antenna Assembly (PAAA).   The SDP hosts the CEP software and is common across all CEC variants.  The USG-2B articles in this budget procure support hardware consisting of a ruggedized 19-inch rack that contains a Cesium time standard, input/output converter, power distribution and user interface control devices. The 19-inch rack holds the SDP.  SBAA and PAAA support are provided by an Antenna Environmental Control Unit (AECU) or Environmental Control System Controller (ECSC), which provide power and cooling oil to the CEC shipboard antenna.  Funding provided also procures the required Weapon Replaceable Assembly (WRA) hardware required for airborne variants of CEC.

A family of antennas approach will be used to satisfy CEC requirements with lower life cycle costs (procurement, installation, and maintenance) and reduced weight (on mast and below deck).  These antennas enable future capability as well as providing a solution extensible to additional platforms.  A competitive contract for Common Array Block (CAB) antenna development and production was awarded late FY13.  CEC is planned for shipboard installations at various Naval and commercial shipyards aboard CG/CG Mod, DDG/DDG Mod, CV/CVN, LPD, LHD, DDG 1000, and LHA ship classes during scheduled ship availability periods and at land based test sites (LBTS).

[P40A / UC002 - AN/UYQ-70 DISPLAY]: This is a sunk cost to fund the procurement of the AN/UYQ-70 display system for use and integration with the CEC system.

[P40A / UC004 - ECP/KIT PROCUREMENT]: These funds are for the procurement and installation of Engineering Change Proposals (ECPs)(AN/USG-2 to AN/USG-2B upgrades/AN/USG-2A to AN/USG-2B upgrades)  Field Change Kits to address CEC parts obsolescence associated with interfacing systems on multiple platforms.

[P40A / UC005 - NON-RECURRING DEPOT COST]: This is a sunk cost to establish a depot for the CEC system.

[P40A / UC006 - VISUAL INTERACTIVE SIMULATED TRAINING APPLICATION (VISTA) TRAINING]: This is a sunk cost to fund VISTA training related to the CEC system.

[P40A / UC008 - SUPPLY SUPPORT]: This is a sunk cost for Supply Support for the CEC system.

[P40A / UC011 - SIGNAL DATA PROCESSORS (SDP) BACKFITS (LBTS)]: Funds are for the procurement of Signal Data Processors (SDP) backfits at Land Based Test Sites (LBTSs).  There are no installation costs associated with these procurements because the installations will be performed by employees at the LBTSs.

[P40A / UC013 - AN/USG-2B HARDWARE CONVERSION KITS (AN/USG-2)]: Funds are for the procurement of AN/USG-2B hardware conversion kits for the CEC AN/USG-2 system configuration.

[P40A / UC014 - AN/USG-2B HARDWARE CONVERSION KITS (AN/USG-2A)]: Funds are for the procurement of AN/USG-2B hardware conversion kits for the AN/USG-2A CEC system configuration.

[P40A / UC015 - AN/USG-2B HARDWARE CONVERSION KITS (LBTS)]: Funds are for the procurement of AN/USG-2B hardware conversion kits for CEC Land Based Test Sites.

[P40A / UC830 - PRODUCTION ENGR. SUPPORT]: These funds are required for the production engineering support of all CEC systems. This Cost Element includes indirect costs associated with the procurement and installation of individual field changes and upgrades. These costs would include field change and upgrade support, consolidated engineering support, Program Office support, and other costs. These costs will fluctuate with increases and decreases of overall budget, number and type of field changes and upgrades, and required support.

[P40A / UCCA1 - CONGRESSIONAL ADD]: These are Congressional add funds.

[P40A / UC016 SYSTEM COMPONENT UPGRADES]: These funds are for the procurement and installation of replacement CEC system components (Surface and Airborne) due to existing component degradation and corrosion as a result of these existing components being in use beyond their intended service life. Funds will support procurement of Environmental Control System Controllers (ECSC) Units and replacement ECSC components, Antenna Environmental Control Units (AECU) and replacement AECU components, Airborne Weapons Replaceable Assemblies (WRAs), replacement components of the Shipboard Active Array (SBAA) Antenna, and replacement components of the Planar Array Antenna Assembly (PAAA) Antenna

[P3A / UC001 - COOPERATIVE ENGAGEMENT TRANSMISSION PROCESSING SET (USG-2/2A/2B)]: These funds are for the procurement of CEC to backfit CG, DDG, CV/CVN, and LHD ship classes, as well as Land Based Test Sites (LBTSs).

[P3A - 2 / UC003 - PAAA BACKFIT KITS]: These funds are for the procurement of Planar Antenna Array Assembly (PAAA) backfit kits.

[P3A - 3 / UC009 - SIGNAL DATA PROCESSOR (SDP) BACKFITS (AN/USG-2)]: Funds are for the procurement of Signal Data Processors (SDP) backfits.

[P3A - 4 / UC010 - SIGNAL DATA PROCESSORS (SDP) BACKFITS (AN/USG-2A)]: Funds are for the procurement of Signal Data Processors (SDP) backfits for AN/USG-2A equipment.

[P3A - 5 / UC012 - COMMON ARRAY BLOCK (CAB) ANTENNA - SHIPBOARD]: Funds are for the procurement of Common Array Block (CAB) antennas for shipboard AN/USG-2B systems.

Justification.val: Funds are to procure hardware and provide associated support for the CEC system. Requirements are driven by planned procurements of Common Array Block (CAB) Antenna , USG-2B ECP/Kits, System Component Upgrades (AECUs, ECSCs, WRAs, Replacement components for SBAA and PAAA antennas), and Installation of CEC Systems for LHD 3 and 5 and Installation of Signal Data Processor (SDP) backfit kits.

These costs would include field change and upgrade support, consolidated engineering support, Program Office support, and other costs. Description.val:
Strike Group Anti-Air Warfare (AAW) Improvement.  These funds are for the procurement and installation of CEC to backfit CG, DDG, CV/CVN, and LHD ship classes, as well as various Land Based Test Sites (LBTSs).

[COOPERATIVE ENGAGEMENT TRANSMISSION PROCESSING SET (USG-2/2A/2B)] Installation costs in FY21 were adjusted to align with latest estimates from In Service Engineering Agent (ISEA).

Name.@footnote: PAAA Backfit Kits are partial systems.  The last option year under the current CEC Production contract is FY 2016.

ImplementationMethodName.val: ALTERATION INSTALLATION TEAM (AIT):: Installation Name: PAAA BACKFIT KITS

Description.val:
Strike Group Anti-Air Warfare (AAW) Improvement.  The Planar Antenna Array Assembly (PAAA) Backfit Kit procurements will be replaced with Common Array Block (CAB) - Shipboard Antenna procurements commencing in FY19. PAAA Backfit Kits are installed on CG, DDG, CVN, LPD, and LHD ship classes

[PAAA BACKFIT KITS] The Planar Antenna Array Assembly (PAAA) antenna being installed in FY 20 will replace an older Shipboard Active Aperture (SBAA) antenna currently in the Fleet.  These SBAAs are very expensive to maintain and some of the parts are becoming obsolete.  PAAA Backfit Kits are installed on CG, DDG, CVN, LPD, and LHD ship classes.

Name.@footnote: A new cost code (UC013) was created and the funding for the hardware conversion kits has been realigned to this cost code for FY13-18. Funds are for the procurement of Signal Data Processors (SDP) backfits in alignment with Fleet Modernization Procurement and Installation Plan for CEC Backfit to CG, DDG, CVN, and LHD ship classes.
The last option year under the prior SDP-S Production contract with Sechan Electronics is FY16.
A competitive follow-on contract was awarded in 4Q FY2017 to DRS Laurel Technologies.

ModificationTitle.val: UC012 - COMMON ARRAY BLOCK (CAB) ANTENNA - SHIPBOARD

Model.val: UC012 COMMON ARRAY BLOCK (CAB) ANTENNA - SHIPBOARD

Title.val: UC012 - COMMON ARRAY BLOCK (CAB) ANTENNA - SHIPBOARD

Name.@footnote: Removed Prior year Procurements and installation costs from FY 17 and Installation costs for FY 18 and FY 19 to reflect congressional reduction in FY 17 ($4.069M) and schedule delays.  Additionally, contracting actions are taking place to enable Planar Array Antenna Assembly (PAAA) production restart for CEC OPN Backfit Antenna requirements in the event of further delays or cost growth to the CAB program and units in order to support on time ship installs.   Unit cost has been updated in accordance with latest proposal pricing from OEM to $7.0M per unit in FY 19 and is escalated in FY21-25. Procurement and installation quantities per year have been lowered due to higher unit cost.  CAB Backfit procurement and installation reductions were made in order to maintain alignment of USG-2B Fleet Installation schedules with the SSDS combat system modernization plans.   Remaining funding was realigned to UC830 and UC004.  Installation costs in FY21-FY25 were adjusted to align with latest estimates from In Service Engineering Agent (ISEA).  Reduced Procurement from 2 to 1 in FY 20 and Installation from 2 to 1 in FY 22 to account for Issue 77102: Common Array Block previously funded. This is a reduction of $4.676M
Name.val: 1.1.1) COMMON ARRAY BLOCK (CAB) ANTENNA - SHIPBOARD - NonOrganic

ImplementationMethodName.val: ALTERATION INSTALLATION TEAM (AIT):: Installation Name: COMMON ARRAY BLOCK (CAB) ANTENNA - SHIPBOARD

Description.val:
Strike Group Anti-Air Warfare (AAW) Improvement.  Funds are for the procurement of Common Array Block (CAB) antennas for shipboard AN/USG-2B systems in alignment with Fleet Modernization Procurement and Installation Plan for CEC Backfit to CG, DDG, CVN, and LHD ship classes. 
CAB program delays and cost overruns have led to delayed Pre-Production Unit (PPU) negotiations as well as cost growth to PPUs and potentially follow on Production Units.  Efforts are underway to reduce cost on future CAB contracts in order to better align with CEC OPN budget.  Additionally, required contracting actions are taking place to enable Planar Array Antenna Assembly (PAAA) production restart for FY 19 and FY20 CEC OPN Backfit Antenna requirements in the event of further delays or cost growth to the CAB program and units in order to support on time ship installs.
Unit cost has been updated in accordance with latest proposal pricing from OEM to $7M per unit in FY 19 and is escalated in FY20-FY25. Procurement and Installation quantities per year have been lowered due to higher unit cost.
